job_description: Join Verition Fund Management in this exciting opportunity.

<p><b><b>WEX Inc.</b></b> is a global commerce platform that has been simplifying the way businesses operate for over 40 years. Our purpose is simple: to reduce administrative burdens, streamline payments, and manage mobility.</p><p></p><p>With a team of over 7,200 professionals across 16 countries. Our specialties are <b>employee benefits, business payments, and fleet/mobility solutions</b>. We support more than 20 million SaaS accounts, 8 million Health Savings Accounts, and 19+ million vehicles worldwide. We're a growing company with a history of innovation and a focus on our customers, making this a great place to grow your career.</p><p></p><p><b><b>The WEX Summer Internship Program: Learn, Lead, and Make an Impact</b></b><br />Our 13-week paid internship program, running from late May to mid-August, is a chance for you to gain real-world experience and develop your skills. Recruiting begins in January and continues through March at our various locations across the U.S.</p><p></p><p>You won't just be a bystander; you'll work on impactful projects and contribute to WEX’s mission. We provide mentorship, professional development, and weekly learning experiences to help you build confidence and leadership skills. High-performing interns may even get the chance to lead their own initiatives.</p><p></p><p>We offer remote, hybrid, and onsite options for flexibility, and our goal is to bring top interns back full-time or offer them extended roles during the school year. Imagine starting your career with a company that’s building what's next. Your future starts here.</p><p></p><p><b>About the team/role:</b></p><p><span>WEX Bank is a leading provider of financial solutions and payment services. We are committed to providing our customers with exceptional service while maintaining the highest standards of compliance and ethical conduct. We are seeking a Regulatory Compliance Intern. The candidate who assumes this role will be a member of the WEX Bank Compliance Team, reporting to the Chief Compliance Officer. In this role, the team member will focus on supporting the compliance team with various compliance activities. </span></p><p></p><p><b>How you'll make an impact:</b></p><ul><li><p>Support the compliance team execute the Bank's overall compliance program as part of the second line of defense. </p></li><li><p><span>Support the development of compliance resources inclusive of checklists, job aids, training, control documentation, procedures, testing scripts, etc. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Support process mapping, control testing and review and/or assist in the development of first line of defense (the business areas) compliance. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Learn how to assess the level of risk associated with any issues found during testing, following established guidelines. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Help report any findings or issues to the team responsible for managing them, including understanding why the issue happened and suggesting ways to fix it. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Build positive and collaborative relationships with colleagues across WEX, especially those in the business areas and other teams. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Assist in creating compliance reports for the Chief Compliance Officer (CCO), Management Compliance Committee (MCC), Management, and/or the Board. </span></p></li></ul><p></p><p><b><span>Experience you'll bring:</span></b></p><ul><li><p>Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's degree program, with a focus in Business, Statistics, Analytics, Pre-Law, Finance, or related.</p></li><li><p>Attention to detail.</p></li><li><p><span>Prior banking experience preferred. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Ability to research regulatory changes and analyze their impact.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Strong communication skills are essential for collaborating with colleagues and communicating with management.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Proficiency in using relevant software and systems is important.</span></p></li></ul><p></p><p></p>The base pay range represents the anticipated low and high end of the pay range for this position. Actual pay rates will vary and will be based on various factors, such as your qualifications, skills, competencies, and proficiency for the role. Base pay is one component of WEX's total compensation package. Most sales positions are eligible for commission under the terms of an applicable plan. Non-sales roles are typically eligible for a quarterly or annual bonus based on their role and applicable plan. WEX's comprehensive and market competitive benefits are designed to support your personal and professional well-being. Benefits include health, dental and vision insurances, retirement savings plan, paid time off, health savings account, flexible spending accounts, life insurance, disability insurance, tuition reimbursement, and more. For more information, check out the "About Us" section.<p></p><p></p>Pay Range: $20.00 - $25.00

The opportunity

Delaware North is hiring a Intern to join our IT team in West Yellowstone, Montana.

 

Are you an undergraduate or graduate student seeking an internship in a fast-paced, inclusive environment with real-world learning opportunities? Delaware North internships are paid and can be completed for academic credit. Summer internship dates typically span 10-14 weeks between: May 2026 and August 2026. 

 

Student is responsible for travel to begin and end internship.  Housing is provided during the course of internship.

 

By participating in our internship program, you will gain valuable work experience, develop your leadership capabilities, and make an impact on the business. You will discover how a global hospitality company operates and work alongside exceptional team members who exemplify our values: Lean Forward, Come Together, Stand Up, Do Right, and Think Guest.

 

All Delaware North interns participate in the Delaware North Intern Experience which includes opportunities for hybrid and in-person work, executive and peer mentoring, and on-the-job learning.

 

Ready to help create the future of hospitality? Apply today to see why this internship is your best career move yet.

Pay

$17.00 - $20.00 / hour

Information on our comprehensive benefits package can be found at https://careers.delawarenorth.com/whatweoffer.

What we offer

We care about our team member’s personal and professional well-being. Delaware North provides a benefits package designed to give you the comfort, safety, and security you need to deliver exceptional experiences for our guests. All team members receive benefits including:

  • Weekly pay
  • Training and development opportunities
  • Employee discounts
  • Flexible work schedules

Eligible team members may also receive: health, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k) with company match, paid vacation days and holidays, paid parental bonding leave, employee assistance program, and tuition and/or professional certification reimbursement.

What will you do?

  • Provide technical support for all computer systems on the property, including configuration, installation, and maintenance of concessions point of sale systems and troubleshooting of TCP/IP, LAN/WAN, Android OS, Windows OS, and network equipment.
  • Assist with day-to-day IT support requests and ticket resolution.
  • Set up and maintain PCs, laptops, printers, and other peripherals for end users, as well as terminating and running low voltage cables (Cat5e/Cat6).
  • Provide application support for point of sale systems and Global Payments.
  • Maintain digital signage throughout the property.
  • Help document systems, procedures, and troubleshooting steps.
  • Perform basic troubleshooting across hardware, software, and network layers.
  • Deploy, configure, and maintain end user devices and operational systems.
  • Navigate and support enterprise platforms.

More about you

  • Pursuing a Degree: Bachelor’s.
  • Area of Study: IT, CIS, MIS, Computer Science.
  • Familiarity with Windows OS and basic familiarity with the OSI model.
  • Strong communication, time management, and troubleshooting skills.
  • Understand how enterprise IT systems support real business operations in hospitality and retail environments.
  • Communicate effectively with technical teams and non-technical staff.

Physical requirements

  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs, climb ladders, and stand or walk for extended periods.

Shift details

Days
8hr shift

Who we are

Our business is all about people, and that includes you. At Delaware North, you’re not just part of a team — you’re part of a global legacy: a family-owned company with 100+ years of history behind it. Our operations span the world, offering you unique paths to growth and success.

Who says you can’t love where you work? With jobs in iconic sports arenas, stunning national parks, exciting casinos, and more, we pride ourselves on giving the world great times in great places. And whether you’re interested in restaurants, hotels, sports, gaming, operations, or retail, part-time or full-time, we’re invested in helping you achieve your career goals.

Together, we’re shaping the future of hospitality — come grow with us!

Delaware North, along with its subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity employer, showcasing job opportunities and considering applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected status.

job_title: Supply Chain Material Cost Estimator Intern
job_description:
Description:By bringing together people that use their passion for purposeful innovation, at Lockheed Martin we keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work. With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work. At Lockheed Martin, we place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering innovation, integrity, and exemplifying the epitome of corporate responsibility. Your Mission is Ours.

Lockheed Martin Space is seeking a Summer 2026 Intern as a Supply Chain Material Cost Estimator Intern. In this role, you will work with proposal teams to produce material estimates. This includes, but is not limited to, collaborating with engineering on material requirements, obtaining price information via historical system data and/or new quotations, and supporting system architecture efforts.

The successful candidate will have experience and/or knowledge of supply chain management, finance, and proposals.

Must be a US Citizen.
Basic Qualifications:
• Currently enrolled in an accredited college with a major in a related discipline such as Supply Chain Management, Finance, Data Analytics, etc.)
• Must be a U.S. Citizen
• Proficient in Microsoft Office suite, especially Excel.
• Strong analytical skills
Desired Skills:
• Ideal candidate would have experience with Procurement, Subcontract Administration, Subcontract Management, Negotiation, Contract, Proposal/Capture, and/or Category Management
• Detail-oriented
• Team player
Clearance Level: None
Other Important Information You Should Know
Expression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.
Ability to Work Remotely: Onsite Full-time: The work associated with this position will be performed onsite at a designated Lockheed Martin facility.
Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits.
Schedule for this Position: Part-Time as assigned by leader
Pay Rate: The annual base salary range for this position in California, Massachusetts, and New York (excluding most major metropolitan areas), Colorado, Hawaii, Illinois, Maryland, Minnesota, New Jersey, Vermont, Washington or Washington DC is $31,616 - $77,788. For states not referenced above, the salary range for this position will reflect the candidate’s final work location. Please note that the salary information is a general guideline only. Lockheed Martin considers factors such as (but not limited to) scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/ training, key skills as well as market and business considerations when extending an offer.
Benefits offered: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, 401(k) match, Flexible Spending Accounts, EAP, Education Assistance, Parental Leave, Paid time off, and Holidays.
(Washington state applicants only) Non-represented full-time employees: accrue at least 10 hours per month of Paid Time Off (PTO) to be used for incidental absences and other reasons; receive at least 90 hours for holidays. Represented full time employees accrue 6.67 hours of Vacation per month; accrue up to 52 hours of sick leave annually; receive at least 96 hours for holidays. PTO, Vacation, sick leave, and holiday hours are prorated based on start date during the calendar year.
Lockheed Martin is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified candidates will be considered without regard to legally protected characteristics.
The application window will close in 90 days; applicants are encouraged to apply within 5 - 30 days of the requisition posting date in order to receive optimal consideration.
At Lockheed Martin, we use our passion for purposeful innovation to help keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work.

With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel, develop, and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work. We place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering an inclusive environment built upon integrity and corporate responsibility.

If this sounds like a culture you connect with, you’re invited to apply for this role. Or, if you are unsure whether your experience aligns with the requirements of this position, we encourage you to search on Lockheed Martin Jobs, and apply for roles that align with your qualifications.
Experience Level: Co-op/Summer Intern
Business Unit: SPACE
Relocation Available: Possible
Career Area: Purchasing/Procurement/Supply Chain
Type: Call-In
Shift: First

job_title: 2026 Summer Intern & Co-Op: Chemical, Mechanical and Electrical Engineering Opportunities
job_description: <div><div><p></p><p><span><span>At <b>DuPont</b>, our paid internship and co-op opportunities are designed to give students more than just a glimpse into the professional world—they’re a launchpad for your future. You’ll work on real, impactful projects alongside experienced DuPont professionals, applying what you’ve learned in the classroom to solve real-world challenges. Through this hands-on experience, you’ll build essential skills, grow your network, and gain exposure to a collaborative, inclusive workplace that values innovation and leadership. You will have the opportunity to collaborate across teams and functions, gaining exposure to innovative technologies and diverse perspectives that drive real-world solutions.</span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span><span>As an Engineering intern or co-op, you’ll:</span></span><span> </span></b></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Embrace DuPont’s core values in safety, sustainability, and innovation</span></span><span> </span></p></li><li><p><span><span>Gain industrial experience and insight into our businesses, products, and customers</span></span><span> </span></p></li><li><p><span><span>Work in team-based environments with mentorship and technical training</span></span><span> </span></p></li><li><p><span><span>Participate in professional development opportunities tailored to your role</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span><span>Our student program offers both internships and co-op assignments tailored to fit your academic schedule and career goals. Assignment length and scope may vary by site and function, but every experience is designed to help you grow, contribute, and lead. Typical roles in manufacturing, operations, and business at DuPont span a wide range of exciting and impactful areas, including Manufacturing Technical and Process Engineering, Capital Projects, Automation and Process Control, Leveraged Engineering, Equipment Reliability and Maintenance, Continuous Improvement, Product Quality, and Technical Service. </span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span>Summer interns and co-ops must be available from May – August. </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><u><span>Requirements</span></u><span> </span></b></p></div><div><p><span><span>To be considered, the following requirements must be met:</span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p>Enrolled as a full-time student pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Chemical, Mechanical, Electrical or other engineering disciplines from an ABET accredited program <span> </span></p></li><li><p><span><span>GPA of 3.0 or higher (out of 4.0 scale)</span></span><span> </span></p></li><li><p><span><span>Legal right to work in the U.S. without restriction</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><p style="text-align:left">At DuPont, our purpose is to empower the world with essential innovations to thrive. We work on things that matter. Whether it’s providing clean water to more than a billion people on the planet, producing materials that are essential in everyday technology devices from smartphones to electric vehicles, or protecting workers around the world. Discover the many reasons the world’s most talented people are choosing to work at DuPont. <a href="https://careers.dupont.com/us/en/whyjoinus" target="_blank">Why Join Us | DuPont Careers</a></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>DuPont is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability or any other protected class. If you need a reasonable accommodation to search or apply for a position, please visit our<span> </span></span><a href="http://www.dupont.com/global-links/accessibility.html" target="_blank">Accessibility Page for Contact Information</a><span>.</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p>The Pay range for this role is $16.10 - $25.30 Hourly<p></p><p><b>How Base Pay is Determined:</b> DuPont has job leveling frameworks that help organize roles based on progressive levels of responsibility, proficiency and qualifications. Each role has an associated pay range (or an established pay rate for some roles) based on the competitive market in each country where we operate. Each individual’s pay is based on a variety of factors, including their role and the associated pay range for that role, their geographic location (i.e., country, state, metropolitan area), as well as their skills, experience, education and certifications, and performance.</p></p>

<p style="text-align:left"><u><b>Work Schedule</b></u></p>Standard (Mon-Fri)<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><u><b>Environmental Conditions</b></u></p>Office<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b><u>Job Description</u></b></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p>When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals. Our staff members are committed to making a difference in our organization, for our client partners and the patients we serve. We seek individuals with proven competencies and strong character to help lead our organization now and into the future.</p><p>Our interns receive<span> </span><b>professional mentorship and leadership development opportunities</b><span> </span>to support future career growth with us. Whether you're looking to come back as a repeat intern, transition into one of our Leadership Development Programs, or pursue a full-time position post-graduation, our team is here to support your next step!</p><p><b>How will you make an impact?</b></p><p>Our interns are matched to projects based on their abilities and current business needs. All projects will have significant strategic and/or operating importance to the business to which they are assigned.</p><p>Summer projects may include the following responsibilities:</p><ul><li>Support and assist with the development of spend category strategies for the assigned area of procurement spend</li><li>Assist with supplier negotiation preparation and all facets of the supplier negotiation strategy development process</li><li>Research, collect, analyze, and draw conclusions from procurement data</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams to prioritize sourcing projects and support project execution</li><li>Assist in supporting a variety of procurement initiatives, including New Product Introductions, Tail Spend Management, and Sustainability</li><li>Communicate, interview, and present recommendations to members of the Procurement team and other important individuals involved.</li><li>Assist with vendor management and supplier data initiatives</li><li>Work collaboratively with other functions to achieve business objectives</li><li>Handle assigned cost reduction and supplier consolidation projects</li><li>Perform special assignments and projects as required</li></ul><p><b>Start Date:</b><span> </span>This internship is set to begin on either May 11th or June 15th, 2026 for a duration of 10-12 weeks – dependent upon student availability per academic calendars.</p><p><b>Compensation & Relocation:</b><span> </span>Our undergraduate Procurement internships offer an hourly rate between $21.50 - $28.75 dependent upon the location you are supporting (aligned to respective cost-of-living guidelines). Additionally, a relocation stipend is offered in the amount of $5,000 if necessary. Student must be located 50+ miles away from the physical location of the internship to be eligible for the relocation stipend.</p><p><b>How will you get here?</b></p><ul><li>Undergraduate student completing an Operations-related degree between December 2026 and June 2027.</li><li>0 years of work experience required; previous related internships preferred.</li><li>Consistent track record of results demonstrating integrity, innovation, involvement, and intensity.</li><li>Energized through championing change, driven in getting results, and savvy in navigating ambiguity.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal communication skills with a high degree of emotional intelligence.</li></ul><p>If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you!</p><p><b>To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States and should not require sponsorship (current or future) for employment visa status. Thermo Fisher does not offer employment in this position to holders of F-1, J-1, H-1, OPT, and CPT Visas for the purpose of obtaining practical experience.</b></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><u><b>Compensation and Benefits</b></u></p>The hourly pay range estimated for this position Intern II based inNorth Carolina is $17.00–$29.00.<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">This position may also be eligible to receive a variable annual bonus based on company, team, and/or individual performance results in accordance with company policy. We offer a comprehensive Total Rewards package that our U.S. colleagues and their families can count on, which includes:</p><ul><li><p style="text-align:left"><span>A choice of national medical and dental plans, and a national vision plan, including health incentive programs</span></p></li><li><p style="text-align:left"><span>Employee assistance and family support programs, including commuter benefits and tuition reimbursement</span></p></li><li><p style="text-align:left"><span>At least 120 hours paid time off (PTO), 10 paid holidays annually, paid parental leave (3 weeks for bonding and 8 weeks for caregiver leave), accident and life insurance, and short- and long-term disability in accordance with company policy</span></p></li><li><p style="text-align:left"><span>Retirement and savings programs, such as our competitive 401(k) U.S. retirement savings plan</span></p></li><li><p style="text-align:left"><span>Employees’ Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) offers eligible colleagues the opportunity to purchase company stock at a discount</span></p></li></ul><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>For more information on our benefits, please visit: </span> <a href="https://jobs.thermofisher.com/global/en/total-rewards" target="_blank"><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span class="WKM0">https://jobs.thermofisher.com/global/en/total-rewards</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></a></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p></p>

Job DescriptionAbout the Role

Uber's Strategic Finance team is uniquely positioned to have transparency into Uber's overall global business and to use financial & operational data to reach insights others might not be able to make. The team is responsible for working closely with cross-functional teams to support financial planning, tracking key financial metrics, driving efficiency, and making product and business recommendations.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to support one of our high growth businesses and use insights to help Uber prioritize initiatives and reach conclusions. As part of the summer program, your deliverable will be a business recommendation to the Strategic Finance Leadership team. This position is based in our San Francisco headquarters.

Pro Tip: Apply early-roles may close sooner than expected due to high demand.

What You'll Do
• Financial Planning: be part of the team that is responsible for financial planning, forecasting, reporting, and analysis for Uber's global business
• Strategic Thinking: Apply business judgment and financial insights to assist with decision making related to new initiatives, products, and business opportunities
• Financial Modeling: Build intricate financial models from scratch, improve existing models, and break complex models down into component parts
• Operational Excellence: Lead initiatives that help us scale from startup to enterprise
Basic Qualifications
• Currently enrolled in a BS/BA program in Finance, Accounting, Economics or a similar field (graduation date Winter 2026 - Spring 2027)
• Basic knowledge of GAAP and experience with Excel/gSheets
• Minimum 1 year of involvement in extracurricular groups, activities, or internship opportunities
Preferred Qualifications
• Prior analytical internship experience in the technology industry, including FP&A, investment banking, management consulting or private equity
• Leadership positions in any extracurricular activities
• Proven understanding of GAAP, enterprise-level financial planning systems, SQL, and/or statistical software packages
• Outstanding analytical skills
• Excellent interpersonal skills
• Ability to structure effective presentations
• Attention to detail and ability to execute in a fast paced environment
• Self-starter - you take initiative, set goals, and meet them
About the Team

We are a global and expansive team that excels at combining strategy and real numbers. We are leaders helping to set the financial and strategic direction of the company.

We are embedded in all the global businesses and functions of Uber, setting the financial plans and operating cadence. However, our work really begins when the plans are set. We proactively connect the dots, set the course, and help the company deliver on its goals!

We also don't just say how it is. We are members of the team that finds and implements the solutions to our biggest challenges.
About Uber

Uber is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Offices continue to be central to collaboration and Uber's cultural identity. Unless formally approved to work fully remotely, Uber expects employees to spend at the least half of their work time in their assigned office. For certain roles, such as those based at green-light hubs, employees are expected to be in-office for 100% of their time. Please speak with your recruiter to better understand in-office expectations for this role.

For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base hourly rate amount for this role is USD$35.00 per hour.

You will also be eligible for various benefits.
Employment Type: OTHER

<p style="text-align:left">You’ve invested a lot of time and energy in your education. Now you want the chance to make your mark. We offer challenging opportunities for you to learn and grow professionally. In our programs, you’ll be immersed in a culture of continuous improvement, with the goal of changing health care for the better.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b>Position Summary:</b></p><p>Health is everything. At CVS Health, colleagues are committed to increasing access, lowering costs, and improving quality of care. Millions of times a day, we help people on their path to better health –from advising on prescriptions to helping manage chronic and specialty conditions. As a 3rd year pharmacy intern, you have a significant role in our company working as a part of the pharmacy team– delivering our purpose, modeling our values, and demonstrating genuine, authentic care for our patients. </p><p></p><p>While working as a 3rd year pharmacy intern, under the direct supervision of a licensed pharmacist, you play a critical role in ensuring a safe and effective Retail Pharmacy work environment that delivers exceptional care to each patient. This includes but is not limited to:</p><ul><li>Patient Safety</li><li>Pharmacy Professional Practice</li><li>Regulatory Requirements</li><li>Quality Assurance</li><li>Customer Service</li><li>Inventory Management</li><li>Workflow Management excluding final prescription verification</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Primary Roles and Responsibility: </b></p><p>A key component of the pharmacy intern role is keeping your customers and patients healthy through adoption and management of patient care programs. Additionally, you will:</p><ul><li>Lead with Heart – display empathy and compassion for your patients, customers, caregivers, and colleagues on your team</li><li>Seek new ways to grow, collaborate with others, and deliver better outcomes</li><li>Align others around our purpose to bring your heart to every moment of your health and gain support and commitment</li><li>Facilitate a team culture that promotes caring, energy, enthusiasm, and pride</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Education:</u></b></p><ul><li>Accepted into or actively enrolled in an ACPE accredited college or school of pharmacy</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Required Qualifications:</u></b></p><ul><li>Accepted into or actively enrolled in an ACPE accredited college or school of pharmacy</li><li>0-3 years relevant work experience</li><li>Must possess or be in process of obtaining valid intern and/or technician licensure as required</li><li>Strong communication and presentation skills</li><li>Complete all required training within state guidelines and required timeframe</li><li>Ability to:<ul><li>Have regular and predictable attendance, including nights and weekends</li><li>Be mobile and remain upright for extended periods of time</li><li>Lift, scan, and bag items</li><li>Finger Dexterity: Picking, pinching, typing or otherwise working primarily with fingers rather than whole hand or arm</li><li>Reach overhead; able to stretch or reach out with the body, arms, and/or legs to grasp items</li><li>Extend hand(s) and arm(s) multiple directions to place, move, or lift items</li><li>Precision control: able to adjust machines to exact positions</li><li>Stoop to a considerable degree and requiring full use of the lower extremities and back muscles to move items between low and high positions, including bending spine at the waist</li><li>Visual Acuity: Close visual acuity to perform activities such as: transcribing, viewing a computer terminal, reading, visual inspection involving small parts</li><li>Able to orally communicate information and instructions to colleagues and customers</li><li>Occasional lifting of up to 20 lbs; exerting up to 20 lbs. of force occasionally and/or up to 10 lbs. of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects</li></ul></li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Ability To: </u></b></p><ul><li>Have regular and predictable attendance, including nights and weekends</li><li>Complete any additional tasks as directed by supervisor or manager</li><li>Complete all required training and obtain required licensure (if applicable) within state guidelines</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Preferred Qualifications:</u></b></p><ul><li>Immunization eligibility</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)</li><li>Once state regulations are met, pharmacy interns should be striving to provide patient immunizations as this is an essential pharmacist function</li></ul><p style="text-align:left"><b>Pay Range</b></p><p style="text-align:left">The typical pay range for this role is:</p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p>$18.50 - $42.00<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p><p style="text-align:left">Whether in our pharmacies or through our health service offerings, we are pioneering a bold new approach to total health care. As health care innovators, we are making quality care affordable, accessible, simple and seamless. We await your fresh ideas, new perspectives, and the unique contributions you will make to our organization.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>We anticipate the application window for this opening will close on: 02/07/2026<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state and local laws.</p>

Strategy MBA Internship

Jumpstart your strategy career and make a business impact at the largest technology solutions company in the world. Dell Technologies is seeking best-in-class, out-of-the-box thinkers to influence our business and play a key strategic role. It’s an exciting time to make a difference, as Dell emerges as the only provider of integrated, end-to-end solutions from cloud to mobility to big data to security.

Join us as an MBA Strategy Intern on our Client Solutions Group in Austin, Texas to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.

What you’ll achieve

As a Dell MBA Strategy intern, you will own a workstream of a strategic project that allows you to have a real impact on the business from day one. In your role you will work individually and within a project team to take on topics such as evaluating new product / business opportunities and identifying process and operational changes to improve business results.

You will:

  • Perform work aligned with your personal career goals and interests to solve complex problems

  • Develop relevant strategy skills that will help you launch a successful career

  • Join in networking opportunities with fellow MBA interns, alumni, and business leaders

  • Learn more about Dell’s career development and rotational programs that focus on building our top talent pipeline and nurturing future leaders

  • Participate in professional development trainings, community service activities, and various ‘showcase Austin’ social events throughout the summer

This internship will provide visibility into Dell’s broader organization while simultaneously allowing you to focus on a specific business unit that most closely aligns with your skills, interests, and career goals. You’ll have the opportunity to work in one of our Client Solutions areas such as:

  • Go-to-market (GTM) strategy for business units such as Consumer & Small Business, Commercial Sales, and Software & Peripherals (SnP)

  • Product portfolio strategy

  • Digital transformation

  • Innovation strategy

  • Expansion into new markets

Take the first step towards your dream career

Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:

Essential Requirements

  • MBA Class of 2027

  • Prior work experience in an analytical or strategic role, or equivalent related experience when you join full-time

  • Very strong understanding of business strategies and drivers

Desirable Requirements

  • Demonstrated skills in fact-based analysis, presentation, and interpersonal interaction

  • Expert problem solving and quantitative analytical skills

Compensation

Dell is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range for this position is $45/hr- $57.50/hr.

Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.

<p><b><b>WEX Inc.</b></b><span> is a global commerce platform that has been simplifying the way businesses operate for over 40 years. Our purpose is simple: to reduce administrative burdens, streamline payments, and manage mobility.</span></p><p></p><p><span>With a team of over 7,200 professionals across 16 countries. Our specialties are<b> </b></span><b>employee benefits, business payments, and fleet/mobility solutions</b><span>. We support more than 20 million SaaS accounts, 8 million Health Savings Accounts, and 19+ million vehicles worldwide. We're a growing company with a history of innovation and a focus on our customers, making this a great place to grow your career.</span></p><p></p><p><b>The WEX Summer Internship Program: Learn, Lead, and Make an Impact</b></p><p><span>Our 13-week paid internship program, running from late May to mid-August, is a chance for you to gain real-world experience and develop your skills. Recruiting begins in January and continues through March at our various locations across the U.S.</span></p><p></p><p><span>You won't just be a bystander; you'll work on impactful projects and contribute to WEX’s mission. We provide mentorship, professional development, and weekly learning experiences to help you build confidence and leadership skills. High-performing interns may even get the chance to lead their own initiatives.</span></p><p></p><p><span>We offer remote, hybrid, and onsite options for flexibility, and our goal is to bring top interns back full-time or offer them extended roles during the school year. Imagine starting your career with a company that’s building what's next. Your future starts here.</span></p><p></p><p><b>About the team/role:</b></p><p>Global Third Party Risk Management (GTPRM) ensures that risks introduced by third-party relationships are identified, assessed, and managed throughout the vendor lifecycle in alignment with regulatory requirements and the company’s risk tolerance.</p><p></p><p><b>How you'll make an impact:</b></p><ul><li><p><span>Providing support to the Vendor Management Team in the assessment of vendor risks.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Resolving the backlog of domestic and international vendors to ensure compliance with WEX Regulatory requirements.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Performing data entry for vendor due diligence analytics.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Promoting operational enhancements through targeted project-based assignments.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Reviewing submitted materials for potential deficiencies and associated risks.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Completing outstanding due diligence for established vendors.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Validating the accuracy of vendor metadata.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Organizing and monitoring the status of due diligence documentation.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Actively lead internal projects around vendor management process improvements.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Work closely with multiple lines of the business and bring strategic visions to key initiatives.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Learn and operate within WEX’s P2P and TPRM tools.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Monitor data for relevant risk changes with the tool and escalate as needed.</span></p></li></ul><p></p><p>You should also expect:</p><ul><li><p><span>A collaborative and challenging working environment.</span></p></li><li><p><span>The opportunity to engage with various stakeholders across the business and senior leadership teams.</span></p></li><li><p><span>To train and develop your skills in your area of work with some of the best experts in the payment industry.</span></p></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Experience you'll bring:</b></p><ul><li><p>At a minimum, you should be a rising Junior or Senior Bachelor's student, in a degree/certificate-seeking accredited program.</p></li><li><p>Strong time management skills, including planning and execution.</p></li><li><p>Strong written and verbal communication skills, including presenting information.</p></li><li><p>Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills.</p></li><li><p>Strong interpersonal and communication skills.</p></li><li><p>Ability to work in a dynamic, collaborative environment, and a willingness to try new things.</p></li><li><p>Ability to work effectively under limited supervision. </p></li><li><p>Experience with Excel and/or Google Sheets is a must.</p></li></ul><p></p><p></p>The base pay range
